text: If you are not familiar, the `--config` and `--account` options are just like the ones in the `hs`<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli| cli>. (Though we should get to having some built in dev-server help soon :thinking_face: …)

Also we’ve changed the npm packages to a `0.2.11` version instead of a prerelease tag. That will make it easier for you to update. So on `npm` a `npm install --force` should do the trick to update (`yarn upgrade` for yarn “classic”)… without needing to manually blow away node_modules/ folders.

<@U01L6S710JD> our <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1671145074380309> update includes several windows fixes. Plus we also updated the hello world repo so that it works out of the box on windows as well: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-blocks-hello-world/pull/7>
Thank you all for your work on this. I am excited about the whole project and how it will change HubSpot development :)

Thanks for surfacing this Dewayne. We built and tested this with npm and "Yarn Classic" and will not be supporting "Yarn Modern" for this initial beta. We've <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1671145074380309|updated> the documentation with our recommended package managers.
